Comments_List: I learned physical and chemical mechanisms that enable water and wastewater treatment. I thought the class was informative and well structured.
A great deal about the physics and chemistry of several processes important in environmental engineering, as well as the context for why they're important to understand.
I learned a lot about processes that are used to treat water
Membrane technologies, flocculation, filtration, disinfection processes.
Knowledge for chemical and physical processes in environmental engineering perspective. I like the lecture notes.
water treatment process and mechanism for every steps
Water treatment, chemical reaction engineering, membrane separation, disinfection
Practice with difficult problem solving, thinking about processes in a mathematical way, proofs, etc. Learned a great deal.

I wish we would have covered topics such as advanced oxidation. I felt we went deep into some topics but only brushed over others, like disinfection. To improve, I would like to gone into more detail on some topics.
Extremely well-organized and well-taught. Plenty of difficult material, but the structure of the class makes it much more approachable and less stressful. No major weaknesses come to mind.
I am not a very big "powerpoint presentation learner," though I know some people are. However, for me, less calculations on the slides and more written out would have been helpful
This class introduces some of the most important technologies in water and wastewater treatment processes. Great!
it is very systematic and well-developed. I think it is a good course.
More practical applications

Workload was high, which was a strength and weakness because I feel like I would have spent more time on problems if I had longer on the problem sets, but also learned a lot from the difficulty level.
Yes, but some topics were not relevant for everyone looking for a higher level understanding of treatment processes.
Absolutely. Whatever a students exact focus in the environmental field is, the material is likely to be useful. Meny does a great job teaching it and makes it an overall pleasant experience.
Yes. I think for the length of the classes, the amount we learned was comparable. It was very well taught.
Yes, because Meny is a great professor
Yes. It will be helpful to future research.
Yes, if you are an environmental engineering students. Some lecture might be involved in future research
yes
Yes. Good course to learn basics of water treatment and membrane processes
Yes, excellent course, excellent instructor.
